issue.description: The city center has no lighting when it is night

ai_recommendation.title: Comprehensive Accessibility Improvement Plan for Sacramento - Poor Lighting
ai_recommendation.description: A detailed, community-focused plan to address poor lighting affecting visual_impairment, walking_aids, elderly in Sacramento. This plan prioritizes safety, independence, and equitable access for all residents.
recommended_actions: Conduct comprehensive on-site accessibility audit with certified accessibility experts
Engage with local disability advocacy groups and affected community members
Perform detailed cost-benefit analysis and secure funding sources
Develop phased implementation timeline with clear milestones
Coordinate with city planning, public works, and disability services departments
Implement ADA-compliant solutions following universal design principles
Establish regular maintenance and monitoring protocols
Create community education and awareness programs
Conduct post-implementation accessibility assessments
Establish feedback mechanisms for continuous improvement
ai_recommendation.expected_impact: Significantly improve accessibility, safety, and independence for seniors, young_adults, children, adults with visual_impairment, walking_aids, elderly, enhancing quality of life and community participation.
ai_recommendation.sdg_alignment: SDG 11.7: Safe and inclusive public spaces
ai_recommendation.equity_impact: Addresses accessibility needs for visual_impairment, walking_aids, elderly in Sacramento
ai_recommendation.plan: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2): Comprehensive assessment and community engagement. Phase 2 (Weeks 3-8): Design and planning with stakeholder input. Phase 3 (Weeks 9-12): Implementation and testing. Phase 4 (Weeks 13-16): Verification, training, and ongoing monitoring.
success_metrics: Enhanced lighting coverage in Sacramento by 90%
75% reduction in safety incidents in poorly lit areas

issue.description: There is a lack of public transport in the city center

ai_recommendation.title: Fresno Public Transport Expansion & Accessibility Enhancement Plan
ai_recommendation.description: A multi-faceted plan to expand public transport options and enhance accessibility in Fresno's city center, ensuring inclusivity for wheelchair users, elderly individuals, and other mobility-impaired residents.
recommended_actions: Infrastructure: Expand bus routes covering key areas like hospitals, shopping centers, and recreational facilities. Install curb cuts, tactile walking signals, and audio/visual announcements at bus stops and stations.
Tech: Implement real-time tracking apps for buses, providing accessible navigation assistance to visually impaired passengers. Introduce automated fare collection systems with easy-to-use interfaces.

Policy: Strengthen local transportation policies to mandate accessibility requirements for private vehicle operators offering shared services within the city limits. Review and update existing ADA compliance standards for public transport.

Community: Collaborate with local disability advocacy organizations to develop targeted outreach campaigns and educational workshops on utilizing enhanced transportation services. Establish a volunteer program to assist seniors and mobility-impaired citizens in navigating the improved public transport system.
ai_recommendation.expected_impact: The proposed plan will significantly improve mobility and independence for wheelchair users, elderly individuals, and other mobility-impaired residents in Fresno's city center. Enhanced transportation options will reduce isolation, increase access to essential services, and promote overall well-being.
ai_recommendation.sdg_alignment: SDG 11.2: Accessible and affordable transport systems
ai_recommendation.equity_impact: Addresses accessibility needs for wheelchair, elderly in Fresno

plan.Phase 1 (Months 1-3): Needs Assessment a: Conduct accessibility audits, gather data on current transport usage patterns, and hold community meetings to identify priorities and concerns.
plan.Phase 2 (Months 4-12): Design and Planni: Develop a comprehensive expansion plan, including route optimization, infrastructure upgrades, and technology integration. Secure necessary funding and permits.
plan.Phase 3 (Months 13-24): Implementation a: Execute infrastructure improvements, install new technology, and train staff on accessibility best practices. Conduct pilot tests with select user groups.
plan.Phase 4 (Months 25-36): Verification, Tr: Verify ADA compliance, conduct performance evaluations, and provide ongoing support and training for staff and users. Continuously monitor and adapt the system based on user feedback.

success_metrics: Enhanced quality of life for all residents
